alert.note: Alert for Northern Somerset; Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:07PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Aroostook and Somerset Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 306 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 23 miles northwest of Saint Pamphile to 11 miles northwest of Lac Frontiere to 16 miles west of Saint Juste. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clayton Lake, Saint Pamphile, Lac Frontiere, Daaquam, Saint Juste, Nine-mile Bridge and Allagash Township. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
